comments.body: Instead of having one such push rule per provider, how about we use a DOCKER_PUSH_CMD variable (which defaults to `gcloud docker -- push`). We'd then just need only the push rule.

I thought about this too, but it relies on DOCKER_PUSH_CMD by an external provider to be 'docker'. In my opinion, it's more readable in the external provider case to not have to run: `make DOCKER_PUSH_CMD=docker REGISTRY=192.xxx.xxx.xxx PROJECT=kubemark`.

Sounds good. I'm fine with either letting it stay the same as now or making 'docker' the default instead of 'gcloud docker' (with a slight preference for this).
Other than that it looks good to me, but I'll let @roberthbailey give the final lgtm.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@	docker build --pull -t $(REGISTRY)/$(PROJECT)/kubemark .

gcloudpush: build
	gcloud docker -- push $(REGISTRY)/$(PROJECT)/kubemark
